thread.title: College UIW at Sam Houston State preview
thread.title_full: College football: UIW at Sam Houston State preview - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Whisler
title: College UIW at Sam Houston State preview
text:
Photo: Mark Lambie /El Paso Times Image 1 of / 1 1 UTEP wide receiver Autrey Golden is tackled in the backfield by Incarnate Word linebacker Myke Tavarres during the first half on Sept. 26, 2015, in El Paso.
Photo: Mark Lambie /El Paso Times UTEP wide receiver Autrey Golden is tackled in the backfield by... College football: UIW at Sam Houston State preview 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Incarnate Word (4-3) at Sam Hou. St. (2-2)
Kickoff: 6 p.m. Saturday, Bowers Stadium, Huntsville
Radio: KONO-AM 860
Series: SHSU leads 3-0.
Matchup: UIW defense vs. Sam Houston State offense — UIW’s improving defense (second in the Southland Conference in total defense) will have its hands full trying to slow down a Bearkats offense that averages 47 points and 588 yards per game.
Players: UIW LB Myke Tavarres — Was named SLC Defensive Player of the Week after recording 15 tackles and 1½ sacks in win over Northwestern State. He’ll need another big game this week; Sam Houston QBs Jared Johnson and Jeremiah Briscoe — Duo share time at the position for the Bearkats, combining for 1,386 yards passing and nine touchdowns.
UIW can win if: Cardinals (2-1 SLC) limit turnovers and find a way to slow Sam Houston’s potent offense.
Sam Houston can win if: Bearkats (2-1 SLC) do what the Cardinals do, limit turnovers and slow down UIW’s offense.
Fun with numbers: UIW quarterback Trent Brittain has 999 yards passing with six TDs to go with 220 yards and four TDs on the ground through the first five games.
